title: Bangladesh Crisis Can Hit Medical Tourism Inflow By 10-15% In 2024: Report
content: The socio-political unrest in Bangladesh has impacted the medical tourism inflow from the neighbouring country and if the turbulence persists the total footfall from the country may drop by 10-15 per cent this year, a report has said.
summary: The socio-political unrest in Bangladesh has impacted the medical tourism inflow from the neighbouring country and if the turbulence persists the total footfall from the country may drop by 10-15 per cent this year, a report has said.

title: Trump, Musk Groove To Bee Gees' 'Stayin' Alive' In AI-Video Now Viral
content: Billionaire Elon Musk today shared an AI-generated video of him and Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump grooving and performing dance steps to Bee Gees' 'Stayin' Alive' song.
summary: Billionaire Elon Musk today shared an AI-generated video of him and Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump grooving and performing dance steps to Bee Gees' 'Stayin' Alive' song.

title: High-Stakes Gaza Ceasefire Talks To Be Held In Doha On Thursday: Report
content: Gaza ceasefire talks will be held in the Qatari capital on Thursday, two sources close to the negotiations said, while it remains unclear if Palestinian Islamist movement Hamas will participate.
summary: Gaza ceasefire talks will be held in the Qatari capital on Thursday, two sources close to the negotiations said, while it remains unclear if Palestinian Islamist movement Hamas will participate.

title: French Athlete Who Took Part In Olympics Suspended For Past Posts On X
content: French 400-meter runner Muhammad Abdallah Kounta, who took part in the Paris Olympics, has been suspended by the French Athletics Federation after an X account dug up hate speech posted by the athlete, the sports minister said on Wednesday.
summary: French 400-meter runner Muhammad Abdallah Kounta, who took part in the Paris Olympics, has been suspended by the French Athletics Federation after an X account dug up hate speech posted by the athlete, the sports minister said on Wednesday.

title: Mars To Acquire Pringles Maker Kellanova For Nearly $36 Billion
content: M&M's and Snickers maker Mars said Wednesday that it would acquire snack food business Kellanova, marking a multibillion dollar agreement set to result in a new industry giant.
summary: M&M's and Snickers maker Mars said Wednesday that it would acquire snack food business Kellanova, marking a multibillion dollar agreement set to result in a new industry giant.

title: 2 French Rafale Jets Collide Mid-Air, Instructor, Pilot Missing
content: Two Rafale fighter jets collided in midair before crashing to the ground in northeastern France on Wednesday, civil and military authorities said.
summary: Two Rafale fighter jets collided in midair before crashing to the ground in northeastern France on Wednesday, civil and military authorities said.

title: US Woman Accidentally Runs Over 12-Year-Old Daughter At School Drop-off
content: A 12-year-old in the US was severely injured after her mother accidentally ran her over on her first day of school.
summary: A 12-year-old in the US was severely injured after her mother accidentally ran her over on her first day of school.

title: North Korea To Open Borders For Foreign Tourists In December
content: North Korea will resume international tourism to its northeastern city of Samjiyon in December, and possibly the rest of the country, tour companies said on Wednesday.
summary: North Korea will resume international tourism to its northeastern city of Samjiyon in December, and possibly the rest of the country, tour companies said on Wednesday.

title: Israeli Airstrikes Target Gaza Ahead Of Ceasefire Talks
content: Israeli air strikes targeted Gaza on Wednesday ahead of ceasefire talks that the United States hopes will stop Iran striking Israel in retaliation for the killing of a Hamas leader.
summary: Israeli air strikes targeted Gaza on Wednesday ahead of ceasefire talks that the United States hopes will stop Iran striking Israel in retaliation for the killing of a Hamas leader.

title: US Navy's Newest Air-To-Air Missile Could Tilt Balance In South China Sea
content: The U.S. Navy's deployment of new extremely long-range air-to-air missiles in the Indo-Pacific could erase China's advantage in aerial reach, experts say, part of an intensifying focus on projecting power amid high tensions in the region.
summary: The U.S. Navy's deployment of new extremely long-range air-to-air missiles in the Indo-Pacific could erase China's advantage in aerial reach, experts say, part of an intensifying focus on projecting power amid high tensions in the region.

title: Ukrainian Troops Moving Further In Russia's Kursk, Says Zelensky
content: President Volodymyr Zelensky on Wednesday said Ukraine's army was advancing in the Russian region of Kursk where it launched a surprise offensive last week.
summary: President Volodymyr Zelensky on Wednesday said Ukraine's army was advancing in the Russian region of Kursk where it launched a surprise offensive last week.

title: 24-Year-Old US Man Arrested For Giving 4-Month-Old Baby Gasoline To Drink
content: A 24-year-old man in the United States has been charged with attempted capital murder after he allegedly tried to kill his 4-month-old baby by feeding the infant gasoline.
summary: A 24-year-old man in the United States has been charged with attempted capital murder after he allegedly tried to kill his 4-month-old baby by feeding the infant gasoline.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Taliban, Three Years On: Still Searching for Manna
content: On August 15, 2021, the Taliban swiftly took over Kabul following the withdrawal of the US-led International Security Assistance Force (ISAF), marking a significant diplomatic setback for India.
summary: On August 15, 2021, the Taliban swiftly took over Kabul following the withdrawal of the US-led International Security Assistance Force (ISAF), marking a significant diplomatic setback for India.

title: Russia Extends Petrol Exports Ban Until 2025 To "Maintain Stable Situation"
content: The Russian government announced Wednesday that it was reintroducing a ban on petrol exports for another six months to "maintain a stable situation" on the domestic fuel market after major price hikes.
summary: The Russian government announced Wednesday that it was reintroducing a ban on petrol exports for another six months to "maintain a stable situation" on the domestic fuel market after major price hikes.

title: Ousted Thai PM Srettha Thavisin Says He "Respects" Court Decision
content: Ousted Thai prime minister Srettha Thavisin said Wednesday that he respected a court ruling that removed him from office in an ethics case.
summary: Ousted Thai prime minister Srettha Thavisin said Wednesday that he respected a court ruling that removed him from office in an ethics case.

title: Rarely Seen Titanic Artefacts Stored In Secret Warehouse In US
content: The collection includes a range of personal belongings and relics, such as handbags, perfume vials still containing fragrances, and countless other items.
summary: The collection includes a range of personal belongings and relics, such as handbags, perfume vials still containing fragrances, and countless other items.

title: France Probes Cyberbullying Of Olympic Boxer Imane Khelif Amid Gender Row
content: France has launched a cyberbullying probe following a complaint by Algerian Olympic boxing champion Imane Khelif, who was at the centre of a gender controversy at the Paris Olympic Games, prosecutors said on Wednesday.
summary: France has launched a cyberbullying probe following a complaint by Algerian Olympic boxing champion Imane Khelif, who was at the centre of a gender controversy at the Paris Olympic Games, prosecutors said on Wednesday.

title: Thai Court Removes PM Over Appointment Of Minister With Criminal Conviction
content: Thailand's Constitutional Court removed Prime Minister Srettha Thavisin from office on Wednesday as it ruled against him in an ethics case that threw the kingdom into fresh political turmoil.
summary: Thailand's Constitutional Court removed Prime Minister Srettha Thavisin from office on Wednesday as it ruled against him in an ethics case that threw the kingdom into fresh political turmoil.

title: New Zealand Charity Apologises For Donating Sweets Containing Lethal Meth
content: A New Zealand charity apologised on Wednesday for distributing dozens of pineapple-flavoured candies that were found to be laced with potentially lethal amounts of methamphetamine.
summary: A New Zealand charity apologised on Wednesday for distributing dozens of pineapple-flavoured candies that were found to be laced with potentially lethal amounts of methamphetamine.

title: Brian Niccol: The Chipotle Boss Who Has Replaced Indian-Origin Starbucks CEO
content: Brian Niccol will take charge as the Starbucks CEO, effective September 1, the company announced on Wednesday. Mr Niccol, a seasoned executive with a proven track record, will succeed Laxman Narasimhan, who stepped down after just over a year.
summary: Brian Niccol will take charge as the Starbucks CEO, effective September 1, the company announced on Wednesday. Mr Niccol, a seasoned executive with a proven track record, will succeed Laxman Narasimhan, who stepped down after just over a year.
